list_definition.definition: (often with to) to make (people) known by name to each other

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He introduced the guests (to each other)
Let me introduce you to my mother
May I introduce myself? I’m John Brown.

list_definition.definition: (often with into) to bring in (something new)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Grey squirrels were introduced into Britain from Canada
Why did you introduce such a boring subject (into the conversation)?
He introduced a bill in Parliament for the abolition of income tax.

list_definition.definition: (with to) to cause (a person) to get to know (a subject etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Children are introduced to algebra at about the age of eleven.

list_ex_of_english: At this point the knight introduces the second part of his ploy.
